intro: Acyntha robusta, commonly known as the robust acyntha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
